thread.title: S & T Bancorp Upgraded to "Buy" by Zacks (STBA)
thread.title_full: S & T Bancorp Upgraded to "Buy" by Zacks (STBA)

title: S & T Bancorp Upgraded to "Buy" by Zacks (STBA)
text:
Tweet 
S & T Bancorp (NASDAQ:STBA) was upgraded by Zacks from a “hold” rating to a “buy” rating in a note issued to investors on Wednesday, Market Beat reports. The firm currently has a $37.00 target price on the financial services provider’s stock. Zacks ‘s target price suggests a potential upside of 13.50% from the stock’s previous close. 
According to Zacks, “S & T BANCORP, INC. is a bank holding company which is engaged in general banking business. The Bank is a full service bank with its main office in Indiana, Pennsylvania, providing service to its customers through a branch of 34 offices located in Armstrong, Allegheny, Indiana, Jefferson, Clearfield and Westmoreland counties. The Bank’s services include accepting time and demand deposit accounts, making secured and unsecured commercial and consumer loans, providing letters of credit, and offering discount brokerage services, personal financial planning and credit card services. “ 
In other S & T Bancorp news, CEO Todd D. Brice acquired 1,029 shares of the company’s stock in a transaction dated Friday, April 24th. The stock was purchased at an average cost of $27.69 per share, for a total transaction of $28,493.01. The purchase was disclosed in a legal filing with the SEC, which is available at this link . Also, EVP David G. Antolik acquired 1,015 shares of the stock in a transaction that occurred on Friday, April 24th. The stock was purchased at an average price of $27.59 per share, with a total value of $28,003.85. The disclosure for this purchase can be found here . 
A number of other firms have also recently commented on STBA. Analysts at Keefe, Bruyette & Woods reiterated a “buy” rating and set a $33.00 price target (up previously from $31.00) on shares of S & T Bancorp in a research note on Wednesday. Analysts at Piper Jaffray downgraded shares of S & T Bancorp from an “overweight” rating to a “neutral” rating and set a $32.00 price target on the stock in a research note on Wednesday. They noted that the move was a valuation call. Analysts at RBC Capital raised their price target on shares of S & T Bancorp from $29.00 to $32.00 and gave the company a “sector perform” rating in a research note on Wednesday. Finally, analysts at Raymond James downgraded shares of S & T Bancorp from an “outperform” rating to a “market perform” rating and set a $30.00 price target on the stock in a research note on Monday, March 30th. Four analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and two have assigned a buy rating to the company’s stock. S & T Bancorp presently has a consensus rating of “Hold” and a consensus price target of $32.50. 
Shares of S & T Bancorp ( NASDAQ:STBA ) traded up 2.07% during mid-day trading on Wednesday, hitting $32.60. 302,363 shares of the company’s stock traded hands. S& T Bancorp has a 1-year low of $23.07 and a 1-year high of $32.88. The stock’s 50-day moving average is $29.47 and its 200-day moving average is $28.53. The company has a market cap of $1.13 billion and a P/E ratio of 17.34. 
S & T Bancorp (NASDAQ:STBA) last posted its quarterly earnings results on Tuesday, July 21st. The financial services provider reported $0.52 earnings per share for the quarter, beating the analysts’ consensus estimate of $0.48 by $0.04. The company had revenue of $62.20 million for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $59.00 million. During the same quarter last year, the company posted $0.49 earnings per share. Analysts expect that S & T Bancorp will post $1.96 EPS for the current fiscal year. 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. ( NASDAQ:STBA ) is a bank holding company. The Company operates through its wholly owned subsidiaries, including S&T Bank, 9th Street Holdings, Inc. and STBA Capital Trust I. S&T operates in three segments: Community Banking, which offers services, which include accepting time and demand deposits, originating commercial and consumer loans, and providing letters of credit and credit card services; Wealth Management, which offers discount brokerage services, services as executor and trustee under wills and deeds, guardian and custodian of employee benefits and other trust and brokerage services, as well as a registered investment advisor that manages private investment accounts for individuals and institutions, and Insurance, includes an insurance agency offering commercial property and casualty insurance, group life and health coverage, employee benefit solutions and personal insurance lines. S&T owns a one-half interest in Commonwealth Trust Credit Life Insurance Company.
